Header: Floods paralyse normal life in northern India
Content: Many cities in northern India have submerged due to flash floods triggered by heavy rains, forcing authorities to shift people to higher ground. Authorities in New Delhi have swung into action as water level in Yamuna river rose significantly due to incessant rains, flooding nearby areas. Authorities are providing makeshift tents, with food and emergency medical services for the rescued people. In northern Kanpur city of India, rains have led to water-logging and traffic jams. Many vehicles shut down while others were half-submerged. Similar scenes played out in Moradabad city, where many houses of a colony were submerged with rain water up to seven to eight feet.
